channel.title: low-code on Anthony Dellavecchia
channel.description: Recent content in low-code on Anthony Dellavecchia

item.title: Daily Sit-Down
item.description: Daily Stand-Up is a meeting that many developers have to do on a daily basis. And it SUCKS! The reasons why we (developers) hate it: It’s just another meeting You have to stand up You have to listen to that one rambling co-worker (aka Chad) I built this app that solves these problems It was built with: Studio, a low-code tool from Twilio Airtable, a database/spreadsheet REST APIs that I built in Python and Flask If you want to try it out, text anything to (844) 668-2535

item.title: Do you like scary movies?
item.description: It’s Halloween! Want to scare your friends and family with a fun app? If you’re familiar with Scream, a famous movie from 1996, there’s a famous scene where a killer calls a victim. Watch it here: I wanted to re-create this scene using Twilio, so I built it with Twilio Studio, a low-code tool from Twilio. If you want to try it out, text anything to (940) 394-8137 I also wrote a tutorial, so you can build this app yourself.

item.title: Build a Halloween Project with Twilio
item.description: TLDR: This is a tutorial on how to build a Halloween project that you can use to scare friends and family. Overview Do you like scary movies? Based on the cult-class film, Screm (1996), I re-created a famous scene from the movie. Try it out by texting (940) 394-8137. Here it is in action: Tutorial Technologies used in this project are Twilio Studio. It’s pretty simple to create because it’s a low-code tool that uses drag n drop.

item.title: TwilioQuest Booth Extension
item.description: If you’ve been a company sponsor at a tech conference, you’d know that attracting attendees is difficult. This project solves that issue, because attendees can interact with a video game while also learning about Twilio products & offerings. TwilioQuest is Twilio’s educational video game. Within the game, you can add your own custom extensions to it. I forked a version of Nathaniel’s, another Twilio Developer Evangelist, and added multiple features/improvements to it.
